arm_group.description: Subjects who lost weight and maintained the new weight
Subjects who lost weight but regained weight again

brief_summary.textblock:
Weight loss maintenance is one of the biggest challenges in the treatment of obesity. The
      neurobiological mechanisms that are involved in successful weight loss maintenance and
      weight control are largely unknown.

      The broad aim of the study is to obtain a better understanding of alterations in mesolimbic
      reward pathways of obese people with and without successful weight loss maintenance.

      This will be achieved by integrating a functional neuroimaging (fMRI) with behavioral reward
      tasks and the modulation of the dopamine level by dopamine depletion.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dopaminergic Function in Weight Loss Maintenance

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  female

          -  healthy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  fMRI contraindications

          -  claustrophobia

intervention.intervention_name: Dopamine depletion vs. Balanced aminoacid drink

facility.name: University Clinic of Tuebingen, MEG Center

other_outcome.description: eating behavior will be measured by state and trait questionnaires as well as a computerized wanting/liking task.
other_outcome.measure: Differences in eating behavior in subjects with and without successful weight loss maintenance during dopamine depletion vs no depletion

primary_outcome.description: differential brain fuctions will be measured by blood oxygen level dependent effect and cerebral blood flow.
primary_outcome.measure: Differential brain functions in the dopaminergic reward system in sucessful and unsuccessful weight loss maintainers.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3.5 hours after intake of a dopamine depletion vs. balanced aminoacid drink

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: structural differences will be measured by diffusion tensor imaging and structural T1 and T2 images
secondary_outcome.measure: structural differences due to different dopamine level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3.5 h after intake of the dopamine depletion or balanced aminoacid drink

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Crossover, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
